alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Rawlins (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Cheyenne and northwestern Rawlins Counties in northwestern Kansas, southwestern Hitchcock and southern Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 715 PM MDT/815 PM CDT/... At 641 PM MDT/741 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Haigler, or 14 miles west of Benkelman, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Cheyenne and northwestern Rawlins Counties in northwestern Kansas, southwestern Hitchcock and southern Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska, including the following locations... Parks, Wheeler and Max. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT/100 AM CDT/ for northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska.
